strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="5">95.7% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="8">peer program ratio median of 89.8%</cite>.
Humaniti Foundation operates with <cite id="7">zero fundraising costs</cite>, ensuring that public donations are not diluted by marketing or solicitation expenses.
The foundation explicitly <cite id="9">accepts Zakat</cite> and serves multiple asnaf categories, including <cite id="10">the poor (fuqara) and the needy (masakin)</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Humaniti Foundation's operational model is characterized by an aggressive focus on direct service delivery. By maintaining a <cite id="5">95.7% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization ensures that every dollar spent is utilized for its <cite id="6">HEAL, Clean Water, and Emergency Relief</cite> initiatives. This efficiency is further bolstered by a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, a rare metric even among established humanitarian peers. For Muslim donors, the organization provides a <cite id="9">clear zakat policy</cite> that covers eight distinct categories of eligibility, including <cite id="10">fisabilillah and ibn_sabil</cite>, ensuring religious compliance in aid distribution.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2023, Humaniti Foundation is a U.S.-based non-profit organization dedicated to <cite id="1">providing humanitarian aid and clean water</cite> through a zakat-eligible framework. Despite its recent inception, the organization has established a significant geographic footprint, operating in crisis-affected regions including <cite id="2">Sudan, Gaza, Pakistan, and Yemen</cite>. The foundation's primary mission is to <cite id="3">raise funds and make distributions for charitable purposes</cite>, focusing on immediate relief and sustainable development. Financially, the organization reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $233,066</cite> in its 2023 tax filing, with a notable <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 95.7%</cite>. This indicates that all reported expenses were directed toward its core initiatives, such as the <cite id="6">HEAL and Clean Water programs</cite>. Furthermore, the foundation maintains high fundraising efficiency, reporting <cite id="7">$0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>, suggesting a lean operational model that prioritizes direct aid delivery over administrative overhead.
